inputs.claim: Water boils at 100°C at sea level.

evidence.name: Wikipedia
evidence.result: Water's boiling point at sea level is 100°C

outputs.label: true
outputs.justification: Evidence explicitly confirms the claim.

inputs.claim: The capital of France is Madrid.

evidence.name: Wikipedia
evidence.result: The capital city of France is Paris

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: Madrid is the capital of Spain, not France.

inputs.claim: Vaccines cause autism.

evidence.name: CDC
evidence.result: No credible scientific evidence links vaccines to autism

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: Extensive research disproves any link between vaccines and autism.

inputs.claim: Gold melts at 1064 degrees Celsius.

evidence.name: Encyclopedia Britannica
evidence.result: The melting point of gold is exactly 1064°C

outputs.label: true
outputs.justification: Evidence explicitly confirms the melting point of gold.

inputs.claim: The Earth is 4.6 billion years old.

evidence.name: NASA
evidence.result: Radiometric dating estimates Earth’s age to be around 4.6 billion years

outputs.label: true
outputs.justification: Scientific consensus and dating methods confirm this age.

inputs.claim: Humans use only 10% of their brains.

evidence.name: Scientific American
evidence.result: Neurological studies show humans utilize most of their brain regions daily

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: Neurological evidence disproves this popular myth.

inputs.claim: Lightning never strikes the same place twice.

evidence.name: National Geographic
evidence.result: Lightning frequently strikes tall structures repeatedly

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: Documented cases of repeated lightning strikes disprove this claim.

inputs.claim: Coffee stunts growth.

evidence.name: Mayo Clinic
evidence.result: No scientific evidence links coffee consumption to growth suppression

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: No scientific studies support this claim.

inputs.claim: Great white sharks are mammals.

evidence.name: Marine Biology Journal
evidence.result: Great white sharks are fish, specifically cartilaginous fish

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: Sharks are classified as fish, not mammals.

inputs.claim: The Amazon rainforest produces 20% of the Earth's oxygen.

evidence.name: National Geographic
evidence.result: The Amazon rainforest contributes approximately 6-9% of global oxygen production

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: Actual scientific estimates are significantly lower than 20%.

inputs.claim: Bananas grow on trees.

evidence.name: Britannica
evidence.result: Bananas grow on large herbaceous flowering plants, not trees

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: Bananas grow on plants that are technically herbs, not trees.

inputs.claim: Albert Einstein won a Nobel Prize in Physics.

evidence.name: NobelPrize.org
evidence.result: Albert Einstein won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921

outputs.label: true
outputs.justification: Historical records confirm Einstein's Nobel Prize.
